io.scanbot.barcodescanner.model

Class BarcodeScannerConfig

  • io.scanbot.barcodescanner.model.BarcodeScannerConfig

  • public class BarcodeScannerConfig

    Entity represents configuration params for class BarcodeScanner

    See Also:
    class BarcodeScanner

    • Constructor Detail

      • BarcodeScannerConfig

        public BarcodeScannerConfig(@NotNull
                            java.util.List<? extends io.scanbot.barcodescanner.model.BarcodeType> barcodeFormats,
                            boolean highSensitivityEnabled,
                            boolean disableMlDetector,
                            int minimumTextLength,
                            int maximumTextLength,
                            int minimum1DQuietZoneSize,
                            boolean gs1DecodingEnabled)

        Entity represents configuration params for class BarcodeScanner

        Parameters:
        barcodeFormats - List of formats to scan. Defaults to BarcodeFormat.COMMON_CODES on SDK level.
        highSensitivityEnabled - Whether high sensitivity scanning mode should be enabled. Defaults to false
        disableMlDetector - Whether ML-based detection should be disabled. Default is false.
        minimumTextLength - Minimum required text length of the detected barcode.The default is 0 (setting is turned off).NOTE: Currently works for ITF barcodes only!
        maximumTextLength - Maximum text length of the detected barcode. Setting to zero removes the limit.The default is 0 (setting is turned off).NOTE: Currently works for ITF barcodes only!
        minimum1DQuietZoneSize - Minimum required quiet zone on the barcode. Measured in modules (the size of minimal bar on the barcode).The default is 10.NOTE: Currently works for ITF barcodes only!
        gs1DecodingEnabled - With this option, the scanner assumes that the barcode can be a GS1 barcode, and modify the behavior as needed.You can set it to NO, if you don't want to see decoded FNC1 characters ("]C1" and ASCII char 29).The default is YES.NOTE: Currently works for CODE128 barcodes only!
        See Also:
        class BarcodeScanner

      • getBarcodeFormats

        @NotNull
public java.util.List<io.scanbot.barcodescanner.model.BarcodeType> getBarcodeFormats()

        List of formats to scan.

        Defaults to BarcodeFormat.COMMON_CODES on SDK level.

        BarcodeFormat.COMMON_CODES

      • getHighSensitivityEnabled

        public boolean getHighSensitivityEnabled()

        Whether high sensitivity scanning mode should be enabled.

        Defaults to false

      • getDisableMlDetector

        public boolean getDisableMlDetector()

        Whether ML-based detection should be disabled.

        Default is false.

      • getMinimumTextLength

        public int getMinimumTextLength()

        Minimum required text length of the detected barcode.

        The default is 0 (setting is turned off).NOTE: Currently works for ITF barcodes only!

      • getMaximumTextLength

        public int getMaximumTextLength()

        Maximum text length of the detected barcode.

        Setting to zero removes the limit.The default is 0 (setting is turned off).NOTE: Currently works for ITF barcodes only!

      • getMinimum1DQuietZoneSize

        public int getMinimum1DQuietZoneSize()

        Minimum required quiet zone on the barcode.

        Measured in modules (the size of minimal bar on the barcode).The default is 10.NOTE: Currently works for ITF barcodes only!

      • getGs1DecodingEnabled

        public boolean getGs1DecodingEnabled()

        With this option,

        the scanner assumes that the barcode can be a GS1 barcode, and modify the behavior as needed.You can set it to NO, if you don't want to see decoded FNC1 characters ("]C1" and ASCII char 29).The default is YES.NOTE: Currently works for CODE128 barcodes only!

        public boolean component7()

        With this option,

        the scanner assumes that the barcode can be a GS1 barcode, and modify the behavior as needed.You can set it to NO, if you don't want to see decoded FNC1 characters ("]C1" and ASCII char 29).The default is YES.NOTE: Currently works for CODE128 barcodes only!
